thread.title: Macquarie veteran Wayne Kent joins Credit Suisse as vice chairman
thread.title_full: Macquarie veteran Wayne Kent joins Credit Suisse as vice chairman | afr.com

author: afr.com
title: Macquarie veteran Wayne Kent joins Credit Suisse as vice chairman
text:
Former Macquarie Capital banker Wayne Kent will start at Credit Suisse on July 13. Arsineh Houspian by Sarah Thompson Anthony Macdonald Jake Mitchell Credit Suisse has hired long-time Macquarie equity capital markets banker, Wayne Kent, as vice chairman of its Australian investment banking business.
The highly-regarded Kent, who retired as Macquarie's global head of equity capital markets in 2011 after more then two decades with the bank, is expected to start in Credit Suisse's Melbourne office on July 13.
Credit Suisse Australia chief executive John Knox announced the appointment to staff on Wednesday afternoon.
"Wayne brings with him extensive experience in the Australian and international markets, both in building businesses and leading transactions," Knox said in a note to staff.
" Under Wayne's leadership, Macquarie's ECM franchise was consistently ranked top 2 in Australia for more than a decade and recognised as one of the country's leading corporate finance advisory houses."
" During that time, he led numerous high-profile corporate transactions, including some of Australia's largest ground breaking and most complex equity and equity-linked raisings."
